intro: Assonia manaharica, commonly known as the Madagascar starflower, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its star-shaped flowers that typically bloom in shades of white and pink. The plant has small, elliptical leaves that are arranged oppositely along the stems. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
